title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that also critiques the British landed gentry.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story of the mysteriously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for Daisy.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: The voyage of the whaling ship Pequod, led by Captain Ahab.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian future where humanity is engineered into castes.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: A gothic novel about a woman’s moral and spiritual development.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy tale about the journey of Bilbo Baggins.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A dystopian future where books are outlawed and burned.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A scientist creates a living being from dead matter.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: The story of a young man who commits a murder and the guilt that follows.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A teenager's critique of the adult world and loss of innocence.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: A horror novel introducing the character of Count Dracula.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: A political satire of the Russian Revolution.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A tragic love story set on the Yorkshire moors.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: Epic journey of Odysseus returning from the Trojan War.

title: Little Women
author: Louisa May Alcott
description: The story of four sisters growing up in Civil War America.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A man sells his soul for eternal youth and beauty.

title: The Time Machine
author: H.G. Wells
description: A scientist builds a machine to travel through time.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: A man sets out to revive chivalry, acting like a knight.
